Text.Language: Anioui m~Po#c# n~nis/ri: n~te Vnou] etc~marwout: a~nioui m~Po#c# n~hanwili: nem hanmaci eukeniw~out.
Present to the Lord, O blessed sons of God, present to the Lord, lambs and fat calves.

Bwrp naf e~p~swi m~pitaio~: nem ouw~ou m~pefran eyouab: a~ribwk m~Po#c# qen ouc~bw: ouoh ouwst qen nefaul/ou eyouab.
Send up unto Him the honor, the glory of His holy name, serve God righteously, and worship in His holy courts.

For the offerings are sent to Him, come into His holy courts, raise on His altar, the calves and the lambs.

David the true chanter, says in great care, I was glad when they said to me, let us go to the house of the Lord.

Come unto, the altar of God, with good praises, and with bloodless oblations.

For truly the maker of the law, who created Adam, became under the law, when He was born of Mary.

When it was eight full days, after his mysterious birth, He completed the Law, and entered the house of circumcision.

The only-begotten God, took our shape in everything, but the sin alone, and He is the Lord of hosts.

And was called Jesus Christ, according to the saying of the angel, before He emptied Himself, in the womb of the Virgin.

And also quickly, when she finished her days, according to the Law of Moses, she washed and was purified.

And after that Simeon, carried Him on his hands, and by that he opened his mouth, and blessed the Lord of the ages.

My eyes have seen Your salvation, now O Lord let Your servant, depart in peace quickly, according to Your saying.

And she came with rejoicing, Anna the prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, and had confessed.

To You is due the glory and the honor, O You the meek in His power, the God the Creator, the old man by His right.

Your name is sweet and blessed, in the mouths of Your saints, we worship You with Your Father, and the Holy Spirit.

Simeon and Anna the prophetess, the voice of the Father, and John the Baptist, and Zacharias his father.

The Son of God Immanuel, He is the true sacrifice, and the oblation and burnt offering, placed on the altar.
